title: Police Arrest a Man in His Sixties
summary: Thames Valley Police arrested a man in his sixties from Norfolk on suspicion of misconduct in public office. The police are searching places in Berkshire and Norfolk. The man is in police custody, but they will not say his name to follow rules and avoid problems in court. Assistant Chief Constable Oliver Wright said they started an investigation after checking a complaint. They want to keep the investigation fair and will share updates later. The police also talk about other things like dangerous drivers and a damaged bridge, but the main story is about the arrest.

background_read: This article is about a police arrest in the UK. Thames Valley Police arrested a man because they think he did something wrong in his public job, which is called misconduct. The police are not saying his name to be fair and follow laws. They are looking into a complaint and searching places to find more information. The police also mention other news like dangerous drivers and a broken bridge, but the main focus is on this arrest.

WHY: To investigate a complaint and keep the investigation fair
